p: Floods bring biological and chemical pollutants, which might ultimately contaminate the groundwater. Flooding events often cause soil erosion associated with chemical pollutants such as organic and inorganic matter, including heavy metals and polycyclic aromatic compounds, which pose threats to groundwater sources and may be taken up by crops and other plants [ 6]. Both fertilizers and flooded soils are sources of polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons [ 6].
